data.title: Liberty Hall
data.text:
Train

Make your way to Central station. Catch a light rail service to Moore Park on the L2 Randwick Line or L3 Kingsford Line to get within a short walking distance of Hordern Pavilion. Light rail services leave from Chalmers Street and bring you to the Moore Park stop which is located on Anzac Parade just north of Lang Road.

Bus

The following regular route buses run from the city and make stops along Anzac Parade:

Routes 338, 374, 376 & 391 depart from Eddy Avenue stand C. Alight at the first stop on the bus roadway at Moore Park.

Routes 372, 393 & 395 depart from Eddy Avenue stand C. Alight at the first stop on Anzac Parade.

We always suggest you check transportnsw.info or the app when planning your trip.

Light Rail

Catch a light rail service to Moore Park on the new L2 Randwick Line to get within short walking distance of the Hordern Pavilion. The Moore Park stop is located on Anzac Parade just north of Lang Road. Services run regularly between Circular Quay and Randwick via Central Station, Chalmers Street from 5am until 1am on weekdays and weekends.

Located just 50 metres from the venue, the EQ has a 2,000 spot multi-storey car park open from 6.00am to 2.00am, 7 days a week. Updated parking rates can be found here

Please check for major event road closures and major event car parking rates if planning to come by car.

Uber/Rideshare

The Entertainment Quarter operates a managed taxi rank within the site from Errol Flynn Boulevard. Rideshare operators such as Uber can pick-up and drop off patrons on Errol Flynn Boulevard and Driver Avenue when no major stadium events are underway resulting in precinct road closures.
